faq.question: What's the best free animation software?
faq.answer: Blender for 3D animation is incredibly powerful and free. OpenToonz is excellent for 2D. Krita has animation features. DaVinci Resolve's Fusion is free for motion graphics.

faq.question: Do I need a drawing tablet?
faq.answer: For hand-drawn animation, absolutely. Wacom is industry standard, but XP-Pen and Huion offer great value. Even basic tablets work for starting out.

faq.question: How long does animation take?
faq.answer: Varies massively. Simple motion graphics: hours. Whiteboard animation: days. Full frame-by-frame: weeks or months per minute. Plan accordingly.

faq.question: Can I animate on an iPad?
faq.answer: Yes. Procreate Dreams, Rough Animator, and FlipaClip work well on iPad. For professional work, desktop software offers more power.
